column2: As a Critical Care Associate at Cloudphysician you will be responsible for patient care delivered remotely at our partner ICUs and at our on ground ICUs in Bengaluru. This is a unique opportunity to be a part of democratizing critical care in our country. You will actively deliver quality critical care remotely to ICUs across India where access to quality critical care is limited. Our intensivists examine critical care problems and solutions at a population level in addition to individual level care. In addition to clinical care, you will have the opportunity to participate in activities of academic excellence in ICU related topics and improve basic life sustaining skills. Our clinical team works closely with our technology team for constant feedback loops and this interaction is unique in the healthcare space.        KEY RESPONSIBILITIES        CCA works closely with the intensivists in providing high quality critical care from our care center, based in Bangalore.      Accompany the intensivist in conducting tele rounds, which involve patient review via camera, discussion with the bedside physicians, review of labs, radiology and drug charts, and compliance to protocols.      Assist the intensivist in documenting findings and plan of care, including communication, in our smart ICU platform, RADAR.      Assist the critical care nurses at the care center in monitoring sick patients including timely reviews and discussion with the bedside nurses or RMOs.      Act as a team leader during CODE BLUE and help the bedside team to provide high quality CPR ( after training).      Actively participate in quality initiatives directed at the betterment of the remote ICUs in the Cloudphysician network and contribute to the team s effort.      Work with the Intensivist at our bedside hospital, if the opportunity arises. The responsibilities include but are not limited to, history and examination, initiate treatment after discussion with the intensivist on ground, documenting findings and plan on RADAR.      Day shifts from the Cloudphysician Care Center Night shifts from the Cloudphysician Care Center 8 hour bed-side shifts in the partner hospitals
column11: Computer vision, Automation, Patient care, Radiology, Critical care, Manager Technology, Healthcare, Data analytics, ICU, Monitoring

column1: Hiring For experienced Home Care Nurse To Work in Qatar.
column2: SUMMARY      Huge Opportunity For Home Care Nurses Who are willing to relocate to Qatar.                 About Client:           Our client is a leading provider of alternative live-in home care support to clients who are elderly, disabled, or in need of a little help getting back on their feet after an accident or illness.           NOTE: Only apply if you are willing to relocate to Qatar.           Experience: 2+ Years of working experience as a B.Sc/ GNM Nursing             JOB SUMMARY:           The Staff Nurse is responsible for providing direct patient care and is responsible for assessing, planning, implementing, and evaluating patients who are in their home or clinical setting.           KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES:           Plan, implement, and evaluate nursing care plans.   Monitoring the client's vital signs & assessing the patient's holistic needs.   Work collaboratively with the physician, staff nurses, and other members of the healthcare team from affiliate institutions.   Administer oral medications and subcutaneous medications such as insulin and erythropoietin while maintaining medication administration safety.   Document nursing care, medications, treatment, and procedures using the company's Nurses Buddy application. Ensure client safety.   Do client assessment and reassessment using the company's approved assessment tools.   Attend refresher training courses, seminars, and training.           KEY COMPETENCIES:           Nursing Care Knowledge   Critical Thinking   Problem-Solving   Attention to Detail and Quality   Multi-Talking Emotional Self Awareness   Pro-activity and Assertiveness   Emotional Self-Awareness of Others   Optimism towards work   Organizational awareness and commitment                 Requirements    REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:           A Ho der of Bachelors Degree in Nursing   Licensed nurse from the country of origin   At least 2 years of working experience as a Registered Nurse                 Benefits  BASIC   PAY   3,000.00   QR    OVERTIME       1,200.00   QR   FOOD   ALLOWANCE   550.00   QR   OTHER   ALLOWNCES   (upon   passing   the   Competency    Assessment)       250.00   QR   ADDITIONAL   OFF   DAY   PAY   (if   two   (2)   days additional rest   day   were   not   be   utilized)   260.00   QR    TRANSPORTATION   ALLOWANCE   PROVIDED   BY   THE   COMPANY   ACCOMMODATION   ALLOWANCE   PROVIDED   BY   THE   COMPANY   TOTAL   MONTHLY   SALARY   Up   to   5,260   QAR

column1: GNM Nurse / Paramedical Nurse Female at Leading NGO
column2: Location: Mahalaxmi,  Mumbai City Employment Type:  Full time Position: Residential (24X7) GNM Nurse Female (Number of Vacancies: 1) Position: GNM Nurse / Paramedical Nurse Female (Number of Vacancies: 5) Job Description: Should be able to identify the needs of children and act upon them Monitoring health/medicals of all children in the children's home Shall be responsible for preparing the child's routine diagnostic checks (monitor pulse, blood pressure, and temperature, and provide medicines and injections. Take children for Medical Tests / Visits of children to OPDs at hospitals / Clinics / Medical Centre  Providing medicines to children.  Quick Action in case of emergencies.  Shall be responsible for treating in medical emergencies, and hospitalisation Hospital Duty if the child is admitted to hospital Should be able to provide immediate First Aid. Assisting/working with the doctors/therapist to provide information about children in care Be responsible in maintaining medical documents/files/tests reports & Information of all children in care Checks and complete records in formats approved by the Trust  Provide quality care/love and affection to the children in care  Carry out the relevant task as asked by the Doctors / Superintendent / Directors & Management Able to prepare health report/records, duty overs, Soft Skills:- Good communications skills Good listener Confidence Stamina to work in shifts Willingness to work at for betterment of the society Mental and emotional strength Sound moral values and work ethics. Desired Candidate Profile   Education:  B. Sc Nursing / GNM / Pediatric Nurse / Paramedical  Language both written and spoken:  Marathi | Hindi | English Work Experience:  Experience or Fresher Perks and Benefits: CTC is not a constraint for experienced candidates and best in the industry. Hours:  Shifty Duty 7 am - 3 pm / 2 pm - 10 pm & 10.00 pm - 7 pm (night shift)  One Weekly off Overtime payment beyond regular duty hours. Entitlement of 30 days paid leave post probation of 6 months. ESIC facility or 2 Lakh Medical Insurance post probation period. Yearly increment based on assessments and decisions of the management.  Contact Details: Bal Asha Trust, King George V Memorial, Rakhangi Chowk, Dr E. Moses Road, Mahalaxmi, Mumbai 400011. To apply please send your resume to  ambika@balashatrust.org  or call on  +91 98345 89425.

column2: Performs patient assessment which includes general inspection and auscultation of the lungs; reviews radiological and laboratory data, vital signs, and physiological calculations; establishes appropriate therapeutic interventions; initiates titrate; discontinues oxygen therapy; and administers medications.      Performs a variety of respiratory tests or invasive or non-invasive procedures such as diagnostic pulmonary function tests, tests to diagnose asthma, oropharyngeal and tracheal suctioning, procurement of sputum samples, tube care, swallowing assessments, and invasive procedures such as arterial line insertions and aspirations, and needle punctures for arterial line samples. Prepares patients for procedures such as bronchoscopy by administering sedative and topical anaesthesia, sets up equipment, monitors patients, prepares, and obtains samples of lung tissue.      Performs arterial blood gas sampling and interpretation.      Documents assessment findings, therapeutic interventions, treatment plans, and recommendations, and prepares reports to referring physicians.      Responds to emergencies (i.e. respiratory and cardiac arrests), providing airway management procedures including endotracheal intubation. Assists with the necessary team during transfers of critically ill patients. Independently, determines and performs respiratory procedures during transports.      Manages invasive and non-invasive respiratory life support equipment of critically ill patients such as mechanical ventilators, medical gas supply lines, and other specialized modalities. Determines suitability for weaning from life support, consults with physicians, and if applicable, weans and/or discontinues patient from devices.      Performs home oxygen assessments/reassessments.      Sets up sleep recording equipment for patients in hospital or at home who require sleep testing. Tests patients for obstructive sleep apnoea, setups of complex sleep recording equipment, and monitors patients during sleep studies.      Downloads, analyses, edits, and scores patient diagnostic sleep studies, generates reports and discusses with respirologist.      Performs exercise testing on patients to assess shortness of breath and oxygen levels to determine whether the patient needs home oxygen therapy and then determines the levels required by administering oxygen.      Obtains patient blood samples, prepares sample for analysis, and analyses blood samples on blood gas analyzer machines.      May attend caesarean sections and high-risk deliveries as part of the resuscitation team.      Educates clients and families regarding respiratory disease, treatment, device (i.e. oxygen for home use), and counsels patients on smoking cessation, lifestyle changes, etc.      Cleans and sterilizes equipment after use. Performs preventative maintenance, troubleshoots, and repairs equipment.      Participates in multi-disciplinary rounds; and assesses and recommends therapy and equipment in discharge planning process.      Participates in the development and delivery of educational programs to patients, families, and members of the healthcare team.      Participates in the development and implementation of quality initiatives and risk management programs.      Performs quality assurance and calibration on pulmonary function equipment.      Acts as a preceptor for students during their clinical placement including supervision and evaluation.      Orders supplies and replaces equipment.      Completes workload measurement statistics. column2: Depending upon your education and experience, you can have different roles and work in a variety of environment, including:     Hospitals:    the kind of work you do in a hospital largely depends upon your specialisation. For example, a cardiac nurse works in the cardiology department and may perform stress test and monitor heart-related vital signs.       Physicians clinics:    in such a work environment, your job will be to help physicians by processing lab tests, assisting in minor procedures, administering medicines and vaccinations and maintaining patient records. Such a role is usually a nine-to-five job.       Outpatient medical facility:    in this type of work, you are responsible for changing dressings, monitoring vital signs and administering medicines. You also supply the required surgical tools and equipment to doctors during medical check-ups and minor surgeries.       Rehabilitation facilities:    in rehabilitation centres, you will primarily take care of people recovering from injuries and chronic conditions like rheumatoid arthritis. You may also need to provide patients with physical therapy to help improve their mobility and flexibility, reduce pain and increase strength.       Home setting:    in this setting, you travel to a patients home to administer medicines, monitor their progress and check their vital signs. Usually, senior citizens and people with disabilities hire you for nursing services at home.
column11: Administration, Stress testing, Nursing, Surgical, Cardiac Nurse, Healthcare, UPS, general nurse, Monitoring, Physical therapy

column2: An Infection Control Nurse is a specialized healthcare professional who is responsible for preventing and controlling the spread of infections within healthcare settings      They play a crucial role in ensuring patient safety and reducing the risk of healthcare-associated infections        Here are some key responsibilities of an Infection Control Nurse:        Developing and implementing infection control policies and procedures: Infection Control Nurses work closely with healthcare administrators, physicians, and other healthcare workers to develop comprehensive infection control policies and protocols      They ensure that these policies comply with local, state, and federal regulations and are based on current evidence-based practices      Monitoring infection control practices: Infection Control Nurses conduct regular surveillance to monitor healthcare-associated infections and identify any trends or outbreaks      They review patient records, laboratory reports, and other relevant data to track infections and evaluate the effectiveness of prevention strategies      Educating healthcare staff: Infection Control Nurses provide ongoing education and training to healthcare workers regarding infection control measures, including hand hygiene, personal protective equipment (PPE) usage, proper sterilization and disinfection techniques, and isolation precautions      They also keep staff updated on new developments and guidelines in infection control      Implementing and evaluating infection prevention measures: Infection Control Nurses are responsible for ensuring that proper infection control measures are implemented throughout the healthcare facility      This includes monitoring hand hygiene compliance, environmental cleaning and disinfection practices, proper handling and disposal of infectious waste, and adherence to standard precautions and transmission-based precautions      Investigating outbreaks and incidents: Infection Control Nurses conduct thorough investigations when there are outbreaks or incidents of healthcare-associated infections      They collaborate with other healthcare professionals to identify the source of the infection, implement appropriate control measures, and prevent further spread
column11: Training, Compliance, Infection Control Nurse, Transmission, Investigation, Healthcare, Monitoring
